DOC.brief_title: Fludeoxyglucose F 18-PET/CT Scans Patients Receiving Ultra Short-Term Dexamethasone For Lung Nodules
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To determine whether ultra short-term steroid therapy ( 24-48 hour ) use increase accuracy fludeoxyglucose F 18 positron emission tomography/computed tomography ( FDG-PET/CT ) image categorize nodule patient pulmonary nodule . - To calculate overall sensitivity specificity nodule group , base FDG uptake , predict malignancy . - To gather effect-size estimate use improve quality large follow-up study . OUTLINE : Patients receive oral dexamethasone 40 , 28 , 16 , 4 hour image . Patients undergo fludeoxyglucose F 18 ( FDG ) -positron emission tomography/computed tomography ( PET/CT ) image baseline upon completion steroid therapy . After completion study therapy , patient follow 6 month .
